column7: How long have you worked for FC?
column9: Which DEI efforts would you like to see prioritized at Foundation Communities? (Select your top 3)
column10: Other (please let us know what other efforts you'd like to see prioritized)
column11: At work, I am treated with respect.
column12: At work, I feel comfortable being myself.
column13: Diversity and Inclusiveness issues are openly discussed.
column14: Employees in my organization are treated with respect and dignity.
column15: Everyone at this organization is treated fairly regardless of ethnic background, race, gender, age, disability, or other differences not related to job performance.
column16: I have the same opportunities for advancement as other team members at my organization with similar experience and performance levels.
column17: If I raised a concern about ethics and integrity, I am confident my employer would do what is right.
column18: My organization treasures diverse opinions and ideas.
column19: My team members appreciate my contributions.
column20: My supervisor tries to understand my point of view.
column21: My workplace is committed to building the strengths of each employee.

column9: Provide training for staff, leadership, and board, Address ways that racial inequity/systemic bias impact issues the organization works on and hold senior team members accountable for anti-racists actions, Work with external community on race equity/inclusion
column10: External diversity trainers with proven outcomes and experience that can guide the work of the DEI committee. Since integrity is equally important, I feel that  members of the committee should be actively doing this restorative work themselves and have experience to hold the organization accountable for anti-oppressive work.

column10: Update the hiring process. The top most eligible/experienced person does not have to automatically get the job. That usually ends up being a class/race inequality. Change metrics of assessing the candidates' qualifications. I understand qualification are non-negotiable and that hiring the best person is very important but in my experience with being in a hiring board, there are many qualified people for jobs, but we tend to want to choose the one that out does all of the rest as far as experience when the other candidates could have still done a great job if given the chance. Plus, some people are just really good at interviews.

column10: 1) Staff of color serving on the Diversity, Equity and Inclusion committee should receive additional compensation. 2) Next time this survey is issued, please combine and revise the "gender" and "gender identity" questions.
